postData.contentHtml:
Relevant information regarding my PhD comprehensive examination.

Exam date & location

May 17, 2022 11:00 - 13:00

College of Education's conference room, Room 227, University Hall 2nd floor, Summerville Campus.

Map

Documents

  1. "On Implicit Computational Complexity with Applications to Real-World Programs"

  2. Presentation slides

List of papers

Committee members can obtain these papers following this link.

  • Gilles Barthe, Delphine Demange, and David Pichardie. â€œFormal Verification of an SSA-based Middle-end for CompCertâ€. In: ACM Transactions on Programming Languages and Systems 36.1 (Mar. 2014), 1â€“35. doi: 10.1145/2579080.

  • Amir M Ben-Amram and Geoff Hamilton. â€œTight Polynomial Worst-Case Bounds for Loop Programsâ€. In: Logical Methods in Computer Science 16.2 (May 2020), 4:1â€“4:39. doi: 10.23638/LMCS-16(2:4)2020.

  • Neil D. Jones and Lars Kristiansen. â€œA Flow Calculus of mwp-Bounds for Complexity Analysisâ€œ. In: ACM Transactions on Computational Logic 10.4 (Aug. 2009), 28:1â€“28:41. doi: 10.1145/1555746.1555752.

  • Jacques-Henri Jourdan et al. â€œA Formally-Verified C Static Analyzerâ€. In: ACM SIGPLAN Notices 50.1 (Jan. 2015), pp. 247â€“259. doi: 10.1145/2775051.2676966.

  • Moyen, Jean-Yves, Thomas Rubiano, and Thomas Seiller. â€œLoop Quasi-Invariant Chunk Detectionâ€œ. In: International Symposium on Automated Technology for Verification and Analysis. Springer, 2017, pp. 91â€“108. doi: 10.1007/978-3-319-68167-2_7.

  • Jean-Yves Moyen. â€œImplicit Complexity in Theory and Practiceâ€œ. HDR, University of Copenhagen, 2017.

Timeline and plan

Date Description
âœ”ï¸ March 28 Possible composition of the committee is sent to program director
âœ”ï¸ April 1 The committee is approved, and the list of paper is shared
âœ”ï¸ April 11 The committee approves the list of papers
âœ”ï¸ April 25 The "Pre-Approval Form" is sent to TGS
âœ”ï¸ May 2 Submission of written document to committee
âœ”ï¸ May 2 Invitations to oral exam are sent to fellow graduate students
âœ”ï¸ May 17 The oral exam, in front of the committee and students
